sn22.83:2.1: “Reverends, the venerable named Puṇṇa son of Mantāṇī was very helpful to me when I was just ordained.
sn22.83:2.3: ‘Reverend Ānanda, the thought “I am” occurs because of grasping, not by not grasping.
sn22.83:2.5: The thought “I am” occurs because of grasping form,
sn22.83:2.9: and consciousness, not by not grasping.
sn22.83:3.1: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, and they check their own reflection in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. They’d look because of grasping, not by not grasping.
sn22.83:3.2: In the same way, the thought “I am” occurs because of grasping form,
sn22.83:3.6: and consciousness, not by not grasping.
sn22.83:4.1: What do you think, Reverend Ānanda?
sn22.83:4.11: They understand: “… there is nothing further for this place.”’
sn22.83:4.12: Reverends, the venerable named Puṇṇa son of Mantāṇī was very helpful to me when I was just ordained.
sn22.83:4.14: And now that I’ve heard this teaching from Venerable Puṇṇa son of Mantāṇī, I’ve comprehended the teaching.”
